docs.lead_paragraph: Another step in a battle that could lead to the Supreme Court is deciding whether President Obama’s legislation goes beyond Congress’s authority to regulate interstate commerce.

docs.lead_paragraph: WAYNE, N.J. - A New Jersey technology company that had been a major contractor on the Bloomberg administration's troubled CityTime payroll project abruptly halted operations and terminated its employees amid a widening city and federal investigation, according to a company memorandum sent out this week. The top two executives of the company, TechnoDyne L.L.C., have returned to their native India, according to people familiar with the case who were not authorized to speak publicly because the investigation was continuing.

headline.main: Company in Payroll Project Shuts Down Amid Inquiry

docs.abstract: TechnoDyne LLC, New Jersey technology company that was a major contractor on Bloomberg administration's troubled CityTime payroll project, abruptly halts operations and terminates its employees amid widening city and federal investigation (M)
docs.snippet: WAYNE, N.J. - A New Jersey technology company that had been a major contractor on the Bloomberg administration's troubled CityTime payroll project abruptly halted operations and terminated its employees amid a widening city and federal investigation,...

docs.lead_paragraph: WAYNE, N.J. — A New Jersey technology company that had been a major contractor on the Bloomberg administration’s troubled CityTime payroll project abruptly halted operations and terminated its employees amid a widening city and federal investigation, according to a company memorandum sent out this week.

headline.main: Company Tied to Payroll Project Shuts Down

docs.abstract: TechnoDyne, a New Jersey company that had hundreds of employees becomes the first casualty of the investigation of CityTime, the city’s automated payroll project.
docs.snippet: TechnoDyne, a New Jersey company that had hundreds of employees becomes the first casualty of the investigation of CityTime, the city’s automated payroll project.

docs.lead_paragraph: At President Obama’s invitation, House Republicans met with him on Wednesday and had a “very frank” airing of their views on reducing the federal debt, saying that the president must agree to deep spending cuts without tax increases, and drop his ideas for increasing spending to stimulate the economy.

headline.main: House G.O.P. and Obama Have ‘Frank Conversation’ on Debt

docs.abstract: In a “productive” meeting with the president on the federal debt, House Republicans said they told Mr. Obama that they oppose any more spending to jump-start the economy.
docs.snippet: In a “productive” meeting with the president on the federal debt, House Republicans said they told Mr. Obama that they oppose any more spending to jump-start the economy.
